uk.ac.ebi.mdk.domain.entity.collection
Interface Genome

All Superinterfaces:
Entity
All Known Implementing Classes:
GenomeImplementation
public interface Genome
extends Entity

Genome - 2011.10.18
The genome defines a container for multiple chromosomes which in turn define locations of contained genes. The genome interface provides convenience methods for accessing chromosomes by number and list all genes in the genome.

Version:
$Rev$ : Last Changed $Date$
Author:
johnmay, $Author$ (this version)

getChromosome

Chromosome getChromosome(int number)
Access a chromosome within the genome by it's number. Attempting to access a chromosome number which does not occur will throw an InvalidParameterException

Parameters:
number - - chromosome number
Returns:
an instance of a chromosome associated with that number

add

boolean add(Chromosome chromosome)
Adds a chromosome to the genome.

Parameters:
chromosome - The chromosome to add
Returns:
whether the chromosome added replaces an existing entry

remove

boolean remove(Chromosome chromosome)
Removes a chromosome from the genome.

Parameters:
chromosome - The chromosome to remove
Returns:
whether the chromosome was removed (false if the chromosome was not present in the genome)

add

boolean add(int number,
            Gene gene)
Convenience method to add a gene to the genome on the specified chromosome. If a number is provided that does not map to a chromosome an InvalidParameterException will be thrown

Parameters:
number - - the chromosome number that the gene will be added too
gene - - a gene to add
Returns:
whether the gene was added to the chromosome
